suffering from or relating to narcolepsy (= a medical condition that makes you go to sleep suddenly): Narcoleptic sleep attacks are brief and may occur when the patient is driving, eating, or conversing. Few narcoleptic syndromes are reported to be associated with a tumour. See
narcolepsy
More examplesFewer examplesI think I'm borderline narcoleptic: I love sleeping. I sleep when I'm nervous as well.Adam starts having narcoleptic fits, waking up in unfamiliar parts of the city.She spoke in a narcoleptic trance to the priestesses attending her.

a person who suffers from narcolepsy (= a medical condition that makes you go to sleep suddenly): It's a prescription drug given to narcoleptics. For a narcoleptic, being made to sit still in a warm classroom is torture. See
narcolepsy
More examplesFewer examplesNone of them had met fellow narcoleptics before, although there are 30,000 in the UK.The fall into sleep will be sudden - narcoleptics are often engaged in an activity when they begin to sleep.Davison stresses that the drug is intended solely for narcoleptics.
